item.title: Removing multiple blank lines when typesetting code listings
item.description: The listings package in LaTeX has an option to collapse multiple empty lines into a single empty line when typesetting code lists. Today, there was a question on TeX.SE how to do something similar when using the minted package. The t-vim module uses the same principle as the minted package. So, I wondered how one could collapse multiple empty lines into a single line in t-vim?
